citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"6c0af185-372d-4481-94b4-bd875d4976f2\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2022-01-25 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est situ\u00e9e entre Denman Island et l\u2019\u00cele de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Conductivit\u00e9/Temp\u00e9rature/Profondeur. Conductivit\u00e9 Temp\u00e9rature Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abr\u00e9g\u00e9 pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivit\u00e9, la temp\u00e9rature et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinit\u00e9, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densit\u00e9 sont des variables qui peuvent \u00eatre d\u00e9riv\u00e9es des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxyg\u00e8ne, des capteurs de turbidit\u00e9 et des fluorom\u00e8tres. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme fixe. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Baynes Sound Conductivit\u00e9/Temp\u00e9rature/Profondeur d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2022-01-25\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/6c0af185-372d-4481-94b4-bd875d4976f2?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"6c0af185-372d-4481-94b4-bd875d4976f2\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Baynes Sound Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2022-01-25\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/6c0af185-372d-4481-94b4-bd875d4976f2?local=en\"}]

          <mcc:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a structured dataset of Coordinate Reference Systems and Coordinate Transformations, accessible through this online registry (www.epsg-registry.org) or, as downloadable zip files, through IOGP's EPSG home page at www.epsg.org. The geographic coverage of the data is worldwide, but it is stressed that the dataset does not and cannot record all possible geodetic parameters in use around the world.</gco:CharacterString>

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 a été déployé le 2022-01-25 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>

      <mmi:maintenanceNote>
        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [dataset title: English = Baynes Sound Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2022-01-25, dataset title: French = Baynes Sound Conductivité/Température/Profondeur déployé 2022-01-25, abstract: English = The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 a été déployé le 2022-01-25 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.] differs from current metadata record [dataset title: English = Baynes Sound Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2022-01-25, dataset title: French = null, abstract: English = The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = null]</gco:CharacterString>

Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 a été déployé le 2022-01-25 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.]</gco:CharacterString>
      </mmi:maintenanceNote>
    </mmi:MD_MaintenanceInformation>
  </mdb:metadataMaintenance>

            <gco:CharacterString>Sea-Bird SBE 19plus V2 SEACAT CTD</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>Self-contained self-powered CTD profiler. Measures conductivity, temperature and pressure (Digiquartz sensor) in both profiling (samples at 4 scans/sec) and moored (sample rates of once every 5 seconds to once every 9 hours) mode. Available in plastic or titanium housing with depth ranges of 600m and 7000m respectively. Miniature submersible pump provides water to the conductivity cell.  Compared to the previous 19plus, the V2 incorporates an electronics upgrade and additional features, with six differentially amplified A/D input channels, one RS-232 data input channel, and 64 MB FLASH memory.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>
      </mac:instrument>

name: 6c0af185-372d-4481-94b4-bd875d4976f2
notes: The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 was deployed on 2022-01-25 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce Sea-Bird SeaCAT SBE19plus V2 4998 a été déployé le 2022-01-25 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Baynes Sound Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2022-01-25

resources.description: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments
